Title: Nurse Meet & Greet 2.0
Body:
Senior co-op students or a soon-to-be-grads, you are invited to the Nurse Meet & Greet networking event on Tuesday, Sept 12th.  It will be held at Gryphs Sports Lounge from 5:30-9pm.  You can come before class, after class or stay and mingle the whole time; it is up to you.

This is not a job fair. There are no booths, no swag - just a relaxed networking night with top nursing employers that are interested in talking to you about upcoming opportunities for co-op and full-time jobs. This event is only open to senior co-op and graduating students in Nursing, Psychology, or General Health majors.

Registration is mandatory for food and beverages (ID is also required). All students who register will receive an email with registered employers, so you can be strategic in your conversations.

Steps To Register:

Login to RG www.recruitguelph.ca
Click on Career; Events/Workshops
Scroll to Tuesday, September 17 on the calendar
Click on the Nurse Meet & Greet 2.0 Event and Register
Keywords: Meet and Greet, Information Session, Networking
Location: Gryphs Sports Lounge, University of Guelph

Title: Patient Safety and Healthcare Conference
Body: This conference will focus on nursing advancements in research and how it may impact clinical practice. It will feature presentations and workshops on this subject matter as well guest speakers from all ocver the world involved in different aspects of nursing. If you are interested in this event, more information can be found at the Patient Safety Conference Series Website.
Sections:
Presentations

The first morning will feature two guest speakers, Dr. Damien Byas president of the North American Science Comitee on Cardiovascular Health in the United States and Mirva Kolonen from the University of Tampere in Finland, speaking about research that they have seen developing over the past five years and their findings. That evening Dr. Nur Birgen, from the Acibadem Healthcare Group in Turkey, will speak to how these finding are changing the way in which patients are treated. The following day there will be a wrap up speach summarizing the content that was covered and on how to take the knowledge learned and proceed better in the future. The speach will also include a formal thank you message to the attendees and guest speaker and will be presented by Dr. Matthias Muenzberg from the University of Heidelberg Germany.

,

Workshops

There will be two workshops durring the course of the conference, the one on the first day about conducting safe and effective research studies and how to efficiently read into them, led by Dr. S M Motahar Hossain Directorate General of Medical Service in Dhaka Cantonment Bangladesh, and one latter on about furthering effective practice, run by Sari Himanen from the University of Tampere in Finland.
